text: I liked it. Great female characters to develop further. It was fun. Girl power💪

I do not understand why they thought this story and idea would be a good idea when it's so far away from the comic book world. 80% of this is running away from the bad guy. There is no reason why the bad guy would have a "Spiderman" costume if there is no Spiderman in this world. The acting was not great very little face movement or depth. You do not need to watch this film, as I would of had a better time washing up than watching this.
Horribly slow first hour twenty, last 20 mins OK, signposts everywhere and a poor script, unfortunately looks like they are going for a sequel

This is actually a great movie, it’s totally coherent and it does make sense, Dakota Johnson is excellent as the titular character, and the use of her new found pre-cog abilities and advanced revelatory powers as the movie goes on are the driving force of the main plot, the vibe of the main cast is excellent too. I would definitely recommend it, also makes sense how the movie has so many views on streaming, people seem to be enjoying it.

I've attended funerals that were more enjoyable than Madame Web.
This should have a government health warning at the start.
You will feel worse for watching it.
Terrible.
Ruined my fav franchise

Far from perfect, but far from the disaster you’ve heard about.

Madame Web arrived with a thud—one of those films whose reputation seemed pre-written long before audiences even bought their tickets. And yes, let’s be honest: the plot zigzags like a spider with a caffeine problem, the dialogue can feel like it's been imported from an early-2000s superhero draft folder, and the tone sometimes shifts so abruptly you wonder if a different director briefly took the wheel.

But here’s the thing: despite the noise, Madame Web is… fun. Genuinely fun. It’s a straightforward, big-swing, popcorn superhero romp that never pretends to be anything else. If you sit back with your brain set to "weekend mode," there’s plenty to enjoy.

Dakota Johnson brings an unexpectedly dry, deadpan energy that keeps the film buoyant, and the trio of future Spider-heroes have a charming, chaotic chemistry that feels like it belongs in a more warmly received franchise. Meanwhile, the action sequences—though not groundbreaking—are brisk, colourful, and pleasantly self-aware.

Is it flawed? Absolutely. Is it the cinematic apocalypse the internet declared? Absolutely not.

Madame Web ends up being the kind of movie you watch with popcorn in hand, laugh at the messy bits, enjoy the good bits, and leave thinking, "Well, that was better than Twitter said it’d be." Sometimes, that’s more than enough.
Not much to say honestly this movie is so ridiculously bad it’s funny 😭

The cast is strong, but they are given such mundane material to work with that they just can't carry the film on their own.

It was more fun at times imagining the direction for some of the scenes or the discussions in the editing room. "You don't think we should shorten this scene by at least one desperate look telegraphing to the clueless villain that something is about to happen? You don't think that strains suspension of disbelief a little too much.?"

I honestly liked it, thought it was a pretty interesting concept, would recommend if you're interested in the concept of the spiderverse. It's probably not for everyone but if you think you may like it then try seeing it.
For a streaming movie it was entertaining but I’m I am happy I didn’t spend any money to see it. It is predictable but cute. The idea was good but it did lack in effort.

I was driven away from this movie until now because of bad reviews.

I Think the movie is nice and entertaining. It tells the story of the origin of Madame web. Definitely critical reviews are very misleading
Oh dear, This was awful. I didn't think it was possible to ruin the whole Spiderman concept

I like the idea and the cast, but the story is so far fetched - I just found myself rolling my eyes as we hit the second half of the film, and I am a very forgiving viewer. It is also riddled with cliches and poor lines - surely a movie with this budget could find some decent writers!
What was that.  Skipped the last 40 minutes to the ending... very glad I did.  S***t movie

I read so many negative reviews of this movie and I so disagree in so so many ways to all the negative reviews. Am I giving it 5 stars...no 5 stars from me you have to undermine our social views and change us for that...and that can be an incredible thing. However I will say strait up people say the acting sucks....it does not, they have to come up at such a fast pace, at possibly a genre that rhey do not know......look what that did to heath ledger. Secondly they are trying to tell a story mostly to people that are missing a lot of the context. Look at the introduction of sentinel. Must people dont even know who he really is...or is supposed to be in mcu. Yes I dont know everything,  but I'm over half a century old and have been following most comics most of my life. Epic, First, Dark Horse! (And hell yea Dark Horse) this movie went levels most marvel movies wouldn't dare...yea even you Mr.Deadpool. it was entertaining,  I would take my children to it...they are young men now! We would enjoy it, and we would talk about it. I feel the real gorilla in rhe room is cgi. Yes CGI, and I will bring that up in my next rant coming soon! All you comic book officinados complaining about cgi now think about the fact we didn't see this Shiz outside of comic books 20 or 30 years ago.....and Check yourself! I have spoken! My favorite hero when I was 14 was The Badger. My favorite hero in my 20s was Eek the Cat, and anyone doesn't realise he's a hero should have just skipped this post! The world's going to heck and we hate cgi!
Great thanks to Adam Scott and Sidney Sweeney for being in it! Each scene they're in are good!
The storyline is great. The acting is great. And the whole movie is great. Why is everyone hating on this movie. Madame web was the best Marvel Sony movie ever. 10 out of 10 🙌🙌🙌🙌🙌🙌🙌🙌

The syntactics of Madame Web's superhuman abilities makes for a novel and subversive experience that has the potential of redefining the linguistics of cinema. Unfortunately, this ambitious subtext is almost immediately overshadowed, if not outright abandoned, by thin, unlikable characters and lazy execution.

I honestly don’t get why people are calling Madame Web one of the worst Marvel movies. I really enjoyed it. The story pulled me in, the acting was great, and the energy stayed strong all the way through. The ending actually hit in a way I didn’t expect.

I also love that it’s an all-women team beating ass and holding their own. It felt powerful without trying too hard—just natural, confident energy. I’d definitely love to see a sequel that builds on this world and gives these characters even more room to shine.

Sometimes we just need to watch movies without expecting them to fit a formula. That’s when you actually see the magic in them.
